title: 3 fonts flyer ID
content:
Happy newyear everybody!!!

I’m trying to recreate a card for a friend, and these fonts came up.  
I’m hoping someone here can help me out...  
Thanks in advance!

Marco

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [typo1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007195112/http:/typophile.com/files/typo1_1.jpg) | 14.94 KB |
| [typo2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007195112/http:/typophile.com/files/typo2.jpg) | 23.4 KB |

 [‹ (x) "TOC" tech sans similar to Bell Gothic - FF DIN {Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007195112/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40470 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Fontshop favicon curly script cap - Julia Script {Florian} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007195112/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40472 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Marco

comments.content: in typo 1 “Productions” is [Fontdinerdotcom](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007195112/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=fontdinerdotcom&page=1&nb_ppp_old=10&text=Productions&nb_ppp=10&psize=m&classt=alpha) and typo2 is [Rat Fink Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007195112/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=20&subpage=viewfonts) by House

“presents” in typo1 may have a customized t, but I think [Swing](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007195112/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/swing/) looks fairly similar. I’m not saying it’s a match, but it’s close.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks both,

the ’presents’ in typo1 is still open for other suggedtions...

Marco
